text: Papakouli 'Pape' Diop (born 19 March 1986) is a Senegalese professional footballer who plays for Spanish club SD Eibar as a defensive midfielder. After starting out at Rennes in France, he went on to spend most of his career in Spain. ==Club career== Born in Kaolack, Diop moved to France at early age and played youth football for Stade Rennais, making his first-team – and Ligue 1 – debut on 5 August 2006, in a 1–2 home loss against Lille OSC. In the summer of 2006 he joined Tours FC, being relegated from Ligue 2 in his first season. On 31 January 2008, Diop signed with Gimnàstic de Tarragona in Spain.El Nástic ficha al senegalés Diop (Nástic sign Senegalese Diop); Marca, 31 January 2008 (in Spanish) After one-and-a-half seasons with the Catalans he moved to La Liga with Racing de Santander, for €1.5 million.Diop se va al Racing y el Nàstic ingresará 1'5 'kilos' (Diop goes to Racing and Nàstic make 1'5 'kilos'); Diario AS, 24 July 2009 (in Spanish) On 12 September 2009, Diop played his first game in the Spanish top level, starting in a 1–1 away draw against Atlético Madrid.Atletico remain winless; ESPN FC, 12 September 2009 His first league goal came on 21 March of the following year, netting the last of a 3–1 success at CA Osasuna.Racing rediscover scoring touch; ESPN FC, 21 March 2010 In the 2011–12 campaign, Diop played all but four matches for the Cantabrians and totalled 2,864 minutes of action,Diop, el 'fichaje' de enero del Racing (Diop, Racing's January 'signing') ; El Diario Montañés, 28 December 2011 (in Spanish) but his team was relegated nonetheless after finishing 20th. Shortly after, he joined fellow league club Levante UD, which paid €100,000 for his services.El Levante paga al Racing de Santander 100.000 euros por Pape Diop (Levante pay 100,000 euros to Racing de Santander for Pape Diop); Goal, 19 July 2012 (in Spanish) On 4 May 2014, Diop appeared to be subjected to monkey chants from a section of Atlético Madrid fans, and provided a unique response by dancing in front of his abusers. On 5 June of the following year, he left the Granotes after his contract expired. On 31 August 2015, Diop signed a three-year deal with RCD Espanyol also in the top tier. On 22 December 2017, after cutting ties with the club, he agreed to an 18-month contract at fellow league team SD Eibar. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center"
